title: Having issues Patching 7.18? Click Here!
body:
Hey all,

What‚Äôs crackin‚Äô folks? Welcome to the 7.18 patch Megathread, also known as the honored World‚Äôs Championship patch! The tension is slowly growing for the best of the best to gather and test their rolls against each other!

http://i.imgur.com/Knb5aBK.gifv

Shockingly, Faker is the best of the entire galaxy.  If you find this patch isn‚Äôt rolling into your computer easily for you, we got you covered! Take a peek at some of troubleshooting we have below for patch problems, or ask us a question and we‚Äôll help below! 

------------------------------------------------

># New skins where?!

New content like skins slated to release during a patch doesn't necessarily mean it will be on the same day.  Bookmark the [News](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/) page for news and info on new or upcoming content.


>#Why does the End of Game Stats screen take FOREVER to freakin' load?!

This might be due to the "Close Client During Game" option in the client.  This option makes the client close out when you enter a game, which means after the game it has to completely reboot to start.  Low Spec Mode should be enough to keep things running smoothly, so disable this option by entering the client, clicking the gear in the upper right hand corner, [and unchecking the box.](http://i.imgur.com/smwR8be.png)

>#I've  tried the Updated Client before, and it was sooooo laggy

We've made some massive changes to the Updated Client make it run as smoothly as possible, even on the proudest of potatoes.  Enable Low Spec Mode if it isn‚Äôt on already.  You can find out by clicking the gear in the upper right hand corner of the Updated Client and then [click "Enable Low Spec Mode"](http://i.imgur.com/rPGRnYW.png)

>#Patching Failed and we're not sure why Error: 004

This error usually occurs when Operating System Permissions isn't set properly.  Essentially, the patcher is trying to access files found on your hard drive, but it is being denied from doing so.  [Follow the steps in this guide to get this resolved!](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

>#Something's up with our servers and it's preventing you from patching Error: 003

Occurs when the patcher isn't able to maintain a stable connection with our Patcher Servers.  If the patcher loses connection to the server to get the necessary files, it will simply stop working.  To get this resolved, [make sure to complete all of the solutions in this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

--------------------------------------

If you have a problem that isn‚Äôt here or those solutions aren‚Äôt working, drop a comment below and we‚Äôll be sure to respond and help you out!  ^.^

It sounds like you're having some massive packet loss issues, which might not be detected by your ping.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) of the impacted games should give you an overview, though.

You'll want to run through the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot, and test it in custom games for now!

We're seeing an abnormal amount of these ghost games today, but they do tend to clear up after enough time. Typically 3-4 hours seems to be enough time for the game to finally clear out, but have you been able to get back into any games at all yet?

Blurry?  That's really strange!  Would you be able to grab a screenshot?  In the meantime, there could be a driver or hardware issue causing this.  Run through the steps in our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to make sure your pc is in good health, and test it in a custom game.  Let me know if that helped.

An unknown DirectX error has occurred and League of Legends cannot start. Please make sure your video card is using the latest video drivers from the manufacturer."
I have checked and my drivers are up to date and i have also uninstalled and reinstalled league. and the problem persists.

There could also be a security setting that's preventing certain files from being accessed.  Run through our [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure League is being added as an exception.  You may then want to download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and perform a force repatch to make sure your game files are being updated correctly.

Glad you were able to get that figured out on your own! It sounds like your pc was trying to scan and alter the games files, but just didn't have the right permissions. If that happens again, try running it as admin!

Hey fellow players! If you are having problems patching, especially with patching stuck at 0% / Release Manifest / Scanning Files, this is what worked for me:


Reset ‚Äòwinsock‚Äô through the Command Prompt:

Press the Windows Key + R
Type cmd (Run Command Prompt as Admin (http://www.sevenforums.com/tutorials/11841-run-administrator.html))
Press ‚ÄúOk‚Äù
Type the following: netsh winsock reset
Hit Enter
Restart your computer
Re-launch League of Legends

For PVP.NET Kernal Not Responding simply 'Run as Administrator".
